Package Collecto

Class Move

  • java.lang.Object
    • Collecto.Move
  • public class Move
extends java.lang.Object
    This class stores and implements moves. It stores the direction and line of a move, where the direction is left, right, up or down, and the line is a row or a column. It supports conversion into a push, which is a move described as an integer between 0 and 27, where 0-6 is left, 7-13 is right, 14-20 is up, and 21-27 is down. It also contains the Direction enum class. It is used by many classes, primarily by the Game and GridBoard classes.
    See Also:
    Game, GridBoard

    • Constructor Detail

      • Move

        public Move​(int line,
            Move.Direction direction)
        Constructs a move with specified line and direction arguments. This class is made for easy and convenient Move arguments handling.

        This class can be constructed to be either line and direction arguments or a push argument.

        Parameters:
        line - line of the move
        direction - direction of the move
        Requires:
        line argument to be between 0 and 7, direction argument to be valid direction, not null

      • Move

        public Move​(int push)
        Constructs a move with specified push argument.
        Parameters:
        push - number of push (according to protocol)
        Requires:
        push argument to be between 0 and 27

    • Method Detail

      • getDirection

        public Move.Direction getDirection()
        Returns the direction of this move.
        Returns:
        direction of this move
        Ensures:

      • getLine

        public int getLine()
        Returns the line of this move.
        Returns:
        line of this move
        Ensures:
        line is a valid line between 0 and 7

      • push

        public int push()
        Calculates and returns the push representation of this move.
        Returns:
        push representation of this move
        Requires:
        direction != null
        Ensures:
        returned push is a valid push according to protocol

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Overrides the toString method to return a more readable string representation of the move in format line+1 direction, e.g. 4 RIGHT. This relies on string representation of the board specifically on enumeration of the lines.

        This method should be used whenever move should be printed to the user in a readable format.

        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object
        Returns:
        readable string representation of the move

      • equals

        public boolean equals​(java.lang.Object o)
        Checks two moves for equality. If the provided object is an instance of the Move class and both line and direction are equal in both classes then the method returns true. Otherwise it will return false.
        Overrides:
        equals in class java.lang.Object
        Parameters:
        o - object to check equality with
        Returns:
        true if Object is a Move instance and all line and direction properties are the same
